thread.title: Summer heat to scorch San Antonio, Texas, on Friday and Saturday | kens5.com
thread.title_full: Summer heat to scorch San Antonio, Texas, on Friday and Saturday | kens5.com

author: KENS 5 Staff (KENS 5)
title: Summer heat to scorch San Antonio, Texas, on Friday and Saturday | kens5.com
text: SAN ANTONIO â€” The KENS 5 Weather Team has called for Weather Impact Alert Days on Friday and Saturday due to above-average temperatures and possible heat advisories in the San Antonio region. What you need to know: As the Saharan dust moves out, high pressure continues to dominate and hot, dry conditions remain in place. Temperatures will near triple-digits on Friday and breach 100 Saturday as an unusually cool July gives way to sweltering August conditions. Heat indices, or "feels-like" temperatures, will hover between 103 and 107 degrees. Though those temperatures could stay below heat advisory criteria, San Antonians should still be cautious if outside for prolonged periods of time. A Weather Impact Alert for Sunday also isn't out of the question. Residents should be extra careful when outside between 2 p.m. and 7 p.m., the hottest part of the day. Wear loose-fitting, light-colored clothes, and drink plenty of water. This is a developing weather event. Refresh the page for the latest updates. Follow the KENS 5 Weather Team: Don't forget you can download the [KENS 5 app](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/san-antonio-news-from-kens-5/id1453203808?ls=1) for the latest news and weather information each day while you are on the go. --- Since going on the air in 1950, [KENS 5 ](/)has strived to be the best, most trusted news and entertainment source for generations of San Antonians. KENS 5 has brought numerous firsts to South Texas television, including being the first local station with a helicopter, the first with its own Doppler radar and the first to air a local morning news program. Over the years, KENS 5 has worked to transform local news. Our cameras have been the lens bringing history into local viewers' homes. We're proud of our legacy as we serve San Antonians today. Today, KENS 5 continues to set the standard in local broadcasting and is recognized by its peers for excellence and innovation. The KENS 5 News team focuses on stories that really matter to our community. You can find KENS 5 in more places than ever before, including [KENS5.com](/), the [KENS 5 app](https://interactive.kens5.com/appredirect/), the [KENS 5 YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/kens5), KENS 5's [Roku](https://channelstore.roku.com/details/f18d9e3902ac2cfc94e8e48a0af1d20f/san-antonio-news-from-kens-5) and [Fire TV](https://www.amazon.com/b?ie=UTF8&node=8521791011) apps, and across social media on Want to get in touch with someone at KENS 5? You can [send a message using our Contacts page](/contact-us) or [email one of our team members](/meet-the-team).
